Historic drought squeezes region's consumers, farmers

The worst drought to hit the nation in a half-century is expected to drive up food and gasoline prices in the coming months. (Boston Globe)

Police: 11-year-old shot in Lawrence

Police say a sleeping 11-year-old girl was grazed by a bullet fired from outside her Brook Street home early this morning. (Globe, 9:12 a.m.)

Cab drivers irate at Uber ban's reversal

A mobile app that has brought luxury car service to the masses is stirring a battle between local cabbies and hired drivers of those livery sedans. (Boston Globe)

barely echoes in the US

The longest war in American history commands little attention or debate — in the halls of Congress, on the presidential campaign trail, or in the public square.

NBA stars don't like it in Boston

Some players don’t see the Celtics in the same light as the Lakers, Heat, Knicks, or Mavericks. It is more a reflection of the state of the NBA than the Celtics.

virtually a one-man operation

Pussy Riot found guilty

In one of the most closely watched cases in recent Russian history, a judge has found three members of the provocative punk band Pussy Riot (pictured) guilty of hooliganism. They face a maximum seven years in prison.
